item.title: Issue #2219 created
item.description:
Generalize method calls to sequences

Adopted from https://github.com/qt4cg/qtspecs/pull/2206#issuecomment-3333242827:

We should further simplify the equivalent code for M =?> N(X, Y, ...) to:

for $map as map(*) in M
return $map?N($map, X, Y, ...)

This would align the syntax with the current generalization of dynamic function calls to sequences, and it would also make the semantics more similar to the sequence arrow operator, which now allows:

123 => (count#1, sum#1)()
